articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Another group of Americans evacuated from China amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Another plane of Americans evacuated from the outbreak zone in China is heading back to the U.S. It comes as China faces harsh criticism for the way it's handled the coronavirus. Ramy Inocencio has the latest.

articles.author: Tucker Reals
articles.title: Doctor told to keep quiet after sounding alarm on coronavirus
articles.description: Li Wenliang was threatened by his government to stop "making false comments."
articles.content: A Chinese doctor who tried to raise the alarm about the new coronavirus before it was even identified was threatened by his government to stop "making false comments." He has since been diagnosed with the illness himself and is being lauded on Chinese social … [+2513 chars]

articles.author: Aimee Picchi
articles.title: Macau shutters casinos over coronavirus fears
articles.description: The suspension in the world's largest gambling center will impact casinos owned by Wynn Resorts and Las Vegas Sands.
articles.content:
Macau, the world's largest gambling center, on Tuesday ordered casinos in the region to halt their operations for two weeks amid concerns about the deadly coronavirus spreading in China and other countries.
Announced by the Macau government on Tuesday, the s… [+978 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: China admits "shortcomings" as global bid to stop new virus ramps up
articles.description: Beijing will let an international team of experts, including Americans, into the country to help fight the virus that has now infected more than 20,500 people.
articles.content: A Chinese doctor who tried to raise the alarm about the new coronavirus before it was even identified was threatened by his government to stop "making false comments." He has since been diagnosed with the illness himself, and is being lauded on Chinese social… [+1632 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus threat spurs mass quarantines around the world
articles.description: With over 20,000 sick worldwide and more than 420 dead in China, countries around the world are going to extreme lengths to try and keep coronavirus contained. But according to experts at WHO, some of these measures might be going too far. Mola Lenghi breaks …

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: China admits "shortcomings" as coronavirus infects more than 20,500 - CBS News
articles.description: There have now been 2 deaths outside of mainland China, and Beijing has agreed to let an international team of experts into the country to help fight the virus.
articles.content: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper on Saturday approved a request from the Department of Health and Human Services for housing support for "1,000 people who may need to be quarantined" due to the coronavirus, according to a Defense Department press release. The … [+1300 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: U.S. planning more flights to evacuate citizens from China
articles.description: Health officials in China are reporting more deaths from coronavirus. The World Health Organization is warning the outbreak could soon be large enough to be classified as a pandemic. Mola Lenghi reports.
